result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Wilson M Medina Cruz

records.addlTxt:
11:15 AM Defendant Wilson M Medina Cruz appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Heather L. Johnson appeared by video for Wilson M Medina Cruz.  Attorney Chad Wozniak appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Sworn as interpreter: Hilda Shymanik.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: West Allis Detective - J. Vanderwerff. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 12. 

*Parties are advised that effective 10/31/2022, pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-17, this case will be reassigned to Branch 34, Judge Yamahiro in Room 423 of the Safety Building.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Wilson M Medina Cruz not in court, in custody.  Attorney Chad Wozniak appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is on standby. Attorney Johnson is unavailable for todays proceedings. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Wilson M Medina Cruz not in court, in custody.  Attorney Heather L. Johnson not in court. Attorney Ian Vance-Curzan in court in person for State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. Defense Counsel does not appear and has not checked in with the court. Case is adjourned. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.

Defendant Wilson M Medina Cruz not in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. State's Witness is present. Appointed Defense Counsel is out of the office and unable to appear. Case is adjourned. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Wilson M Medina Cruz not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness was present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with N. M-L., S. M-L.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

CASE HEARD OFF THE RECORD DUE TO TECHNICAL DIFFICULTIES: 
 Defendant Wilson M Medina Cruz in court with attorney Margo Elise Clark.  Defendant Wilson M Medina Cruz in custody.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Borowski, Branch 12. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 12.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
